column2: MASSACHUSETTS DMV PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A steady green light at intersections means:
column6: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear
column8: You must stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: There is a traffic signal ahead
column8: You must stop ahead

column2: 3. You can pass on the right:
column4: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.
column10: when passing is restricted by parked cars.

column2: 4. Roads are most slippery:
column8: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 5. When they see this road sign, drivers should:
column4: drive carefully because the animal pictured on the sign is extremely rare in the area.
column6: be ready to hit a reindeer.
column8: watch for this species crossing the road.

column2: 6. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 7. This road sign is:
column8: a guide sign.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turn

column2: 9. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 10. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: an intersection ahead.

column2: 11. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: may turn left only on a green arrow.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Left turns are permitted
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 13. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: NO TURN ON RED.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column8: Buggy warning

column2: 15. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column8: increase your speed immediately.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 16. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column8: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 18. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column8: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 19. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column8: parking lights.

column2: 20. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Honk your horn.

column2: 21. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column8: yellow warning lights.

column2: 22. Parking is not allowed:
column8: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 23. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 24. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.
column8: you must wait for the red light to turn green.

column2: 25. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
